function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Increase in off-site construction may lead to a higher risk of contagious diseases transmission due to transportation of materials and workers from various locations.","Impact":"Potential for a rapid spread of contagious diseases in construction sites and off-site construction facilities, leading to a higher risk of infection among workers.","Mitigation":"Implement strict health and safety protocols for workers, conduct regular testing, and enhance sanitation measures in construction sites and off-site facilities.","Technologies":"Use of contactless technology, remote monitoring, and automated construction processes to reduce the need for direct human interaction.","People":"Workers, construction site personnel, off-site construction facility workers, and the general public in areas where off-site construction takes place.","Owner":"Construction companies, project managers, health and safety authorities, and government regulatory bodies."},{"Description":"Increased use of digital techniques and technologies in construction may facilitate the spread of misinformation and fake news related to contagious diseases.","Impact":"Misinformation and fake news can lead to panic, fear, and non-compliance with health and safety guidelines, potentially exacerbating the spread of contagious diseases.","Mitigation":"Promote credible sources of information, educate workers and stakeholders on identifying misinformation, and implement fact-checking processes for digital communication channels in the construction industry.","Technologies":"Data analytics and machine learning algorithms for identifying misinformation, secure communication platforms, and digital verification tools for information authenticity.","People":"Construction industry professionals, workers, project stakeholders, and the general public exposed to construction-related information.","Owner":"Industry associations, construction companies, and regulatory authorities."},{"Description":"Rapid shelter construction and emergency constructions may lead to overcrowding and inadequate ventilation, increasing the risk of airborne contagious diseases transmission.","Impact":"Potential for the rapid spread of airborne contagious diseases in emergency shelters and crowded construction areas, leading to a higher risk of infection among occupants and construction workers.","Mitigation":"Design emergency shelters with adequate ventilation systems and proper spacing, implement occupancy limits, and conduct regular air quality monitoring. Ensure proper sanitation and hygiene facilities in crowded construction areas.","Technologies":"Use of advanced ventilation systems, real-time occupancy monitoring, and mobile sanitation facilities for construction sites and emergency shelters.","People":"Occupants of emergency shelters, construction workers, and individuals residing near construction sites.","Owner":"Architects, construction companies, emergency response agencies, and government regulatory bodies."}]}
